qas.question: What was partly destroyed by Allied bombings in 1944?
What organ did Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart play on?
Where is the Silbermann organ located?
What is the Neo-Gothic church called?
In what century was the Eglise Saint-Etienne constructed?
What style of building is the Saint-Pierre-le-View Protestant?
What style of building is the Ancienne Douane?
What city was Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart from?
What type of glass is in the Eglise Saint-Ettienne?

context: In addition to the cathedral, <b7_0>Strasbourg<b7_0/> houses several other medieval churches that have survived the many wars and destructions that have plagued the city: the <a0_0><b5_0>Romanesque<b5_0/> Église Saint-Étienne<a0_0/>, partly destroyed in 1944 by Allied bombing raids, the part Romanesque, part Gothic, very large <a2_0>Église Saint-Thomas<a2_0/> with its <a1_0>Silbermann organ<a1_0/> on which Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Albert Schweitzer played, the Gothic Église protestante Saint-Pierre-le-Jeune with its crypt dating back to the seventh century and its cloister partly from the eleventh century, the Gothic Église Saint-Guillaume with its fine early-Renaissance <b8_0>stained<b8_0/> glass and furniture, the <b6_0>Gothic<b6_0/> Église Saint-Jean, the part Gothic, part Art Nouveau Église Sainte-Madeleine, etc. The Neo-Gothic church <a3_0>Saint-Pierre-le-Vieux Catholique<a3_0/> (there is also an adjacent church Saint-Pierre-le-Vieux Protestant) serves as a shrine for several <b4_0>15th-century<b4_0/> wood worked and painted altars coming from other, now destroyed churches and installed there for public display. Among the numerous secular medieval buildings, the monumental Ancienne Douane (old custom-house) stands out.
